intro: Chironia pulchella, commonly known as the pretty chironia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. Chironia pulchella is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
